definitions.definition: to throw something lightly or carelessly
definitions.sensetop: toss something + adv./prep.toss something to somebodytoss somebody something

examples.text: I tossed the book aside and got up.
He tossed the ball to Anna.
He tossed Anna the ball.
He tossed the letter over to me.
She tossed her jacket onto the bed.
She picked up the package and casually tossed it into her bag.
The bodies were unceremoniously tossed into mass graves.
The improvements had to be tossed overboard because of lack of money.
It's an idea that gets tossed around from time to time.

definitions.definition: to throw a coin in the air in order to decide something, especially by guessing which side is facing upwards when it lands
definitions.sensetop: toss somethingtoss (somebody) for somethingtoss up (for something)toss up between A and B

examples.text: Let's **toss a coin**.
There's only one ticket left—I'll toss you for it.
We tossed up to see who went first.
He had to toss up between *(= decide between)* paying the rent or buying food.
examples.contextForm: toss up between A and B

definitions.definition: to move your head suddenly upwards, especially to show that you are annoyed or impatient

examples.text: She just tossed her head and walked off.
She tossed back her blonde hair.

definitions.definition: to move or make somebody/something move from side to side or up and down

examples.text: Branches were tossing in the wind.
I couldn't sleep but kept **tossing and turning** in bed all night.
She tossed about restlessly all night with a high fever.
Our boat was being tossed by the huge waves.

definitions.definition: to shake or turn food in order to cover it with oil, butter, etc.

examples.text: Drain the pasta and toss it in melted butter.
Toss the vegetables lightly in olive oil.
Pour the vinaigrette over the salad and toss well.

definitions.definition: to throw a pancake upwards so that it turns over in the air and lands back in the frying pan so you can fry the other side
